CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 11, 1954, pg. 1 reads: "Prosecutor and Key Witnesses - Assistant District Attorney Samuel Strauss (left), who, with his office's backing, demanded death in the electric chair for William (Buttons) Cole, confers with two of his key witnesses - Martin Cordoran, detective, and Capt. Joseph T. Flynn, who presented a shocking signed confession that they took from Cole shortly after his May 20 killing of Pearline Williams. Cole, testifying in his own behalf, on Tuesday, told the court that the statement was true. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Assistant District Attorney Samuel Strauss, Detective Martin Cordoran, and Captain Joseph T. Flynn, standing in corridor of Allegheny County Courthouse for William "Buttons" Cole trial
